abstracts.cdata!:
This additional grant to the state of
            Eritrea for the Power Distribution and Rural Electrification
            Project. This additional grant will support the completion
            of the ongoing part A: the Asmara component of the project
            to rehabilitate the distribution system in the city in view
            of cost overruns arising from higher unit costs of
            electrical materials. The additional grant will also support
            a new component for the overhaul and rehabilitation of key
            power generation plants at Hirgigo, Beleza and Assab.
            Overhaul and rehabilitation of the generation plants will
            ensure that electricity supply is maintained and outages are
            avoided. Overhaul has been postponed as the cost of the
            replacement parts could not be funded from European Economic
            Community (EEC's) capital expenditure program. While
            well operated power companies finance the rehabilitation of
            their generation plants from internal funds, EEC cannot
            presently do so as its revenues have been insufficient to
            meet its operating expenses since 2006 when international
            fuel prices began to raise. If oil prices had remained at
            their pre 2006 levels, EEC would have been able to carry out
            the rehabilitation from its internal resources.
